Name: Sebastian
description:
Sebastian is a young and skilled entrepreneur and coffee farmer from Suaza, Huila, who has amassed 17 years of experience in coffee farming. He currently owns a small convenience store in his house, from which he sells multiple daily products. Sebastianâ€™s main income comes from a 4-hectare plot of land that was passed down by his grandparents, where he cultivates 12,000 coffee trees along with 1,200 plantain trees.

Sebastian firmly believes in sustainable farming practices by which he fertilizes his crops using 100% organic waste, minimizing environmental impact while maximizing the health and productivity of his coffee plants.

Sebastian lives with his parents in a house they purchased over 32 years ago. He is a loving son and constantly supports them by maintaining the house.

Sebastian is requesting loan of $3,434,704 COP which he will use to restock his convenience store and purchase 10,000 coffee seedlings. This loan will allow him to continue his business and extend his coffee fields.
